Text: Clap your hands, all you nations; shout to God with cries of joy.
Context: The psalm opens with a universal call to praise, inviting all nations to express their joy for Godâ€™s sovereignty.

Text: For the LORD Most High is awesome, the great King over all the earth.
Context: Recognition of God's supreme authority and power over the earth, a reason for reverence and joy.

Text: He subdued nations under us, peoples under our feet.
Context: A celebratory acknowledgment of God's victory and favor to His people, leading to triumph over enemies.

Text: He chose our inheritance for us, the pride of Jacob, whom He loved.
Context: Exudes gratitude for God's provision and special affection for Jacob (Israel), indicating chosenness and favor.

Text: God has ascended amid shouts of joy, the LORD amid the sounding of trumpets.
Context: Portrays God's ascension as a king amidst celebration, indicating divine victory and cause for exuberant praise.

Text: Sing praises to God, sing praises; sing praises to our King, sing praises.
Context: A call to repeated and intentional praise, emphasizing the importance of worshiping God as king.

Text: For God is the King of all the earth; sing to Him a psalm of praise.
Context: A direct statement of God's sovereignty over the earth, inviting the creation of psalms that honor Him.

Text: God reigns over the nations; God is seated on His holy throne.
Context: Descriptive assertion of God's reigning position over all nations, denoting stability and authority.

Text: The nobles of the nations assemble as the people of the God of Abraham, for the kings of the earth belong to God; He is greatly exalted.
Context: Reflects unity as leaders gather before God, acknowledging His ownership and exalted status over all rulers.

Text: He chooses our inheritance, the glory of Jacob, whom He loved. Selah
Context: A reiteration of God's selective grace toward Jacob, calling for reflective pause (Selah) to contemplate.
